snippet: Jonathan Lippman, the state’s chief judge, said the system unfairly detained many people and did not allow judges to consider public safety when determining bail.
abstract: New York State Chief Judge Jonathan Lippman calls for overhaul of bail system that would bring state closer in line with rest of the country; says state process is unfair to the poor and does not allow judges to consider public safety when determining bail.
lead_paragraph: Jonathan Lippman, the state’s chief judge, said the system unfairly detained many people and did not allow judges to consider public safety when determining bail.

headline.seo: Lippman, New York’s Chief Judge, Seeks to Overhaul Bail Process
headline.main: Top Judge Says Bail in New York Isn’t Safe or Fair
headline.print_headline: Top Judge Says Bail in New York Isn’t Safe or Fair
